page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content:
TRANSPORT SAFETY MOTORWAY HATFIELD BUILDING AlM TUNNEL HATFIELD
AlM peak times congestion near British Aerospace factories needed easing, so the new road - Stanborough to Roestock was begun l984 costing Â£55m and taking 3 years to construct. A major feature is the ll50m long 'cut and cover' tunnel through which the motorway will pass, so making the AlM continuous through Herts. Through traffic will use the tunnel, leaving the old roads for local traffic. The safety officer took my class into the tunnel when it was being built. We had to stay close. Moving machines had flashing lights and men wore safety helmets and bright jackets. Muddy wheels on lorries were washed before joining traffic. The whole area was fenced off from the public.
